titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 695) to amend the National Child Protection Act of 1993 to establish a voluntary national criminal history background check system and criminal history review program for certain individuals who, related to their employment, have access to children, the elderly, or individuals with disabilities, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 695) to amend the National Child Protection Act of 1993 to establish a voluntary national criminal history background check system and criminal history review program for certain individuals who, related to their employment, have access to children, the elderly, or individuals with disabilities, and for other purposes.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1183.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-1090, by Mr. Cole.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 199.

action.text: On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223 - 178 (Roll no. 468).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 221 - 179 (Roll no. 469).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 695) to amend the National Child Protection Act of 1993 to establish a voluntary national criminal history background check system and criminal history review program for certain individuals who, related to their employment, have access to children, the elderly, or individuals with disabilities.
